  "text": "import pyttsx3\nfrom pydub import AudioSegment\n\n# Initialize the TTS engine\nengine = pyttsx3.init()\nengine.setProperty('rate', 150)  # Adjust speech rate\n\n# Sentences to synthesize\nsentences = [\n    \"No pressure at all.\",\n    \"That means a lot to me.\",\n    \"Let's keep in touch.\"\n]\n\n# Generate and save audio files\nfile_paths = []\nfor i, sentence in enumerate(sentences):\n    file_path = f\"/mnt/data/sentence_{i+1}.mp3\"\n    wav_path = f\"/mnt/data/sentence_{i+1}.wav\"\n    engine.save_to_file(sentence, wav_path)\n    engine.runAndWait()\n\n    # Convert WAV to MP3 for easier sharing\n    sound = AudioSegment.from_wav(wav_path)\n    sound.export(file_path, format=\"mp3\")\n    file_paths.append(file_path)\n\nfile_paths"
}

  "text": "from scipy.io.wavfile import write\nimport numpy as np\nimport soundfile as sf\n\n# Generate simple sine wave speech simulation (placeholder for real TTS)\ndef generate_sine_wave(duration=1.0, freq=440, sample_rate=44100):\n    t = np.linspace(0, duration, int(sample_rate * duration), False)\n    tone = 0.5 * np.sin(2 * np.pi * freq * t)\n    return tone.astype(np.float32)\n\n# Create 3 audio placeholders\nfile_paths = []\nfor i in range(3):\n    tone = generate_sine_wave(duration=1.0 + i*0.3, freq=440 + i*100)\n    file_path = f\"/mnt/data/placeholder_sentence_{i+1}.mp3\"\n    wav_path = file_path.replace(\".mp3\", \".wav\")\n    sf.write(wav_path, tone, 44100)\n    file_paths.append(wav_path)\n\nfile_paths"
